alert.note: Alert for Cleveland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 10:16PM EDT until September 30 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cleveland. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1013 PM EDT, The chances for additional heavy showers will gradually diminish through midnight, but localized excessive runoff will keep stream and river levels elevated along with the threat of lingering areas of high water after a widespread nearly 3 inch rainfall event for Cleveland County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shelby, Kings Mountain, Boiling Springs NC, Belwood, Grover, Lawndale, Patterson Springs, Fallston, Polkville, Lattimore, Mooresboro, Waco, Casar, Earl, Kingstown, Crowders Mountain State Park, Kings Mountain State Park and South Mountains State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
